problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the perimeter of the BEFC parallelogram is 66, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 20257.98)
C = (8240.02, 4237.21)
D = (2769.49, -5306.030000000001)
E = (14656.9, 16914.68)
F = (22862.69, 893.92)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 12))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 25034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-9965.77, 30034.23)

# Draw the cyan triangle (A, B, C)
cyan_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C], closed=True, color="cyan", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_triangle)

# Draw the lime triangle (A, C, D)
lime_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, C, D], closed=True, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(lime_triangle)

# Draw the green polygon (B, E, F, C)
green_polygon = patches.Polygon([B, E, F, C], closed=True, color="green", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(green_polygon)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, B, C, A)  # Right angle at C in triangle ABC
draw_right_angle(ax, D, A, C)  # Right angle at A in triangle ACD

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((A[0] + D[0]) / 2, (A[1] + D[1]) / 2, "6", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")
ax.text((C[0] + D[0]) / 2, (C[1] + D[1]) / 2, "11", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="center")
ax.text((B[0] + E[0]) / 2, (B[1] + E[1]) / 2, "15", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The length of the hypotenuse of the ACD triangle is 11 and the length of the AD side is 6, so the length of the AC side is $\sqrt{11^2 - 6^2} = \sqrt{121 - 36} = \sqrt{85} = 9.22$. The perimeter of the BEFC parallelogram is 66 and the length of its BE side is 15 so the length of the BC side is $\frac{66}{2} - 15 = 33.0 - 15 = 18$. The lengths of the AC and BC sides of the ABC triangle are 9.22 and 18, so the length of the hypotenuse (the AB side) is $\sqrt{9.22^2 + 18^2} = \sqrt{85.01 + 324} = \sqrt{409.01} = 20.22$. Therefore the final answer is 20.22.
